meanings.definition: A person or thing that entrains.
meanings.sent1: The entrainers on the train helped passengers find their seats.
meanings.sent2: The entrainers at the airport guided travelers to their gates.
meanings.sent3: The entrainers at the zoo made sure all the visitors followed the correct path.
meanings.sent4: The entrainers in the orchestra conducted the musicians with precision.
meanings.sent5: The entrainers in the dance class kept everyone in sync with the music.

meanings.definition: A substance that causes another substance to become entrained.
meanings.sent1: The oil acted as entrainers, mixing with the water effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The soap served as entrainers, blending the scents together in the soap-making process.
meanings.sent3: The sugar and flour were the entrainers in the recipe, binding all the ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The music was the entrainers of emotions, stirring feelings within the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The wind acted as entrainers, carrying the scent of flowers through the air.

meanings.sent1: The entrainers of the parade brought joy to the spectators.
meanings.sent2: The entrainers of the dance performance captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The entrainers of the comedy show had everyone laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The entrainers of the event set the mood for a festive celebration.
meanings.sent5: The entrainers of the play engaged the audience from start to finish.
